content: The Act titled "Securing America's Energy Independence Act of 2007" extends and modifies the investment tax credit for solar energy and fuel cell property. The Act "Securing America's Energy Independence Act of 2007" extends and modifies the investment tax credit for solar energy and fuel cell property by amending various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This includes updating the years for eligibility, expanding the definition of energy property to include excess energy storage devices, and incorporating solar hybrid lighting systems into the tax credit provisions. The Act "Securing America's Energy Independence Act of 2007" extends and modifies the investment tax credit for solar energy and fuel cell property by amending various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This includes updating the years for eligibility, expanding the definition of energy property to include excess energy storage devices, and incorporating solar hybrid lighting systems into the tax credit provisions. The amendments also specify that solar lighting equipment can use fiber-optic distributed sunlight to illuminate structures. Additionally, there is a special rule for determining the energy credit for solar photovoltaic energy property based solely on kilowatt capacity. The Act "Securing America's Energy Independence Act of 2007" amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend and modify the investment tax credit for solar energy and fuel cell property. It includes a special rule for the energy credit for solar photovoltaic energy property, specifying a credit of $1,500 for each half kilowatt of capacity placed in service during the taxable year. This rule applies to property used to generate electricity and not subject to certain other provisions. The amendments made by this section shall take effect on January 1, 2007. The amendments made by the "Securing America's Energy Independence Act of 2007" extend and modify the investment tax credit for solar energy and fuel cell property. The effective dates for the amendments are January 1, 2007, except for property placed in service after December 31, 2006. SEC. 3. Extension and modification of credit for residential energy efficient property. Extension and modification of the credit for residential energy efficient property include amending the termination date to 2016, removing the 30 percent allowance for solar electric property, and setting maximum credits for different types of qualified property expenditures. The text discusses amendments to the credit for residential energy efficient property, including changes to qualified property expenditures for solar water heating, fuel cell property, and photovoltaic property. The amendments made to the credit for residential energy efficient property include changes to qualified property expenditures and the allowance of the credit against alternative minimum tax. Unused credit can be carried forward to the succeeding taxable year. Effective date for these amendments is after December 31, 2006. SEC. 4. 3-YEAR ACCELERATED DEPRECIATION PERIOD FOR SOLAR ENERGY PROPERTY AND FUEL CELL PROPERTY. The text chunk discusses amendments to the Internal Revenue Code related to property descriptions for tax purposes, specifically for solar and wind energy properties. The amendments made by this section apply to wind energy properties as of December 31, 2006.
